  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN BAY 32. RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (BAGGS) AND BROUGHT SPILL CART AND DECISION TREE. ON INSPECTION, IT WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT, RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE RESPONSE SHEET FOR CORROSIVE HAZMAT AND BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025050000
item.description:
Report E-2025050000

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-30
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 30, 2025, three (3) 1-gallon jugs of sodium hydroxide were damaged and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and a neutralizing agent to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025050051
item.description:
Report X-2025050051

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: CHICAGO

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN BAY 7. RESPONDER DONNED FULL PPE (BAGGS) AND BROUGHT SPILL CART AND SPILL TRAY. ON INSPECTION, IT WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT WITH A WET BOX THAT LEFT NO PUDDLE. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE HAZMAT ACCORDING TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2025051379
item.description:
Report X-2025051379

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-01T01:13:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-21
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: An FRA inspector observed the smell of Ethanol from # UTLX 209125 from the manway cover while performing a regulatory compliance check at the CN Glenn Yard in Chicago, IL. The inspector notified the CN Dangerous Goods Officer who responded to the incident location. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer's inspection of tank car revealed vapor leaking from the gasket sealing surface between the manway nozzle and the manway cover plate indicating a possible gasket failure. This was confirmed by using a 4 gas meter. The manway cover was opened for inspection of the gasket. The gasket appeared to be dry rotted and was replaced. The manway cover swing bolts were then tightened in a star pattern with a 24" pipe wrench.

item.title: Report E-2025040637
item.description:
Report E-2025040637

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-28T03:42:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-31
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails in a paper box due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the pails and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
